trustfund: TF035693-BRAZIL - GAS SECTOR DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF035270-BRAZIL - GAS SECTOR DEVELOPMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome and achievement of
            objectives of the Gas Sector Development Project is rated as
            highly satisfactory. The lessons learned from this project
            include: 1) This project clearly demonstrates the high value
            added brought by the Bank in such a complex public-private
            infrastructure project involving a whole spectrum of risks -
            political, regulatory, environmental, and social, while
            being important for regional economic development and
            integration. 2) This cross-border ownership was tackled
            through technical, environmental, financial, and market
            committees comprised of experts provided by all the
            sponsors. 3) The sector reform objectives were described in
            a policy letter sent by the Government of Brazil to the
            Bank. The policy letter approach includes mechanisms for
            joint review, to implement difficult sector reforms, rather
            than agreeing on a set of rigid conditionalities. 4) It is
            important to secure the first tranche of transport capacity
            for the first contracts, but ensure that at least some
            uncommitted upside capacity be available for use by third
            parties and will be auctioned according to the criteria set
            by the regulator. 5) It is key to have both an independent
            auditor and an ombudsperson as they have different functions
            regarding the monitoring of social and environmental
            compensation and mitigation programs and the protection of
            individual and community rights, as well as proactively
            interacting with nongovernmental organizations and communities.
